00039 #ifndef RPL_H
00040 #define RPL_H
00041 
00042 #include "lib/list.h"
00043 #include "net/uip.h"
00044 #include "net/uip-ds6.h"
00045 #include "sys/ctimer.h"
00046 
00047 /* set to 1 for some statistics on trickle / DIO */
00048 #ifndef RPL_CONF_STATS
00049 #define RPL_CONF_STATS 0
00050 #endif /* RPL_CONF_STATS */
00051 
00052 /* 
00053  * Select routing metric supported at runtime. This must be a valid
00054  * DAG Metric Container Object Type (see below). Currently, we only 
00055  * support RPL_DAG_MC_ETX and RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY.
00056  */
00057 #ifdef RPL_CONF_DAG_MC
00058 #define RPL_DAG_MC RPL_CONF_DAG_MC
00059 #else
00060 #define RPL_DAG_MC RPL_DAG_MC_ETX
00061 #endif /* RPL_CONF_DAG_MC */
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * The objective function used by RPL is configurable through the 
00065  * RPL_CONF_OF parameter. This should be defined to be the name of an 
00066  * rpl_of_t object linked into the system image, e.g., rpl_of0.
00067  */
00068 #ifdef RPL_CONF_OF
00069 #define RPL_OF RPL_CONF_OF
00070 #else
00071 /* ETX is the default objective function. */
00072 #define RPL_OF rpl_of_etx
00073 #endif /* RPL_CONF_OF */
00074 
00075 /* This value decides which DAG instance we should participate in by default. */
00076 #define RPL_DEFAULT_INSTANCE           0x1e
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * This value decides if this node must stay as a leaf or not
00080  * as allowed by draft-ietf-roll-rpl-19#section-8.5
00081  */
00082 #ifdef RPL_CONF_LEAF_ONLY
00083 #define RPL_LEAF_ONLY RPL_CONF_LEAF_ONLY
00084 #else
00085 #define RPL_LEAF_ONLY 0
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 /*
00089  * Maximum of concurent rpl-instances
00090  */
00091 #ifndef RPL_CONF_MAX_INSTANCES
00092 #define RPL_MAX_INSTANCES     1
00093 #else
00094 #define RPL_MAX_INSTANCES     RPL_CONF_MAX_INSTANCES
00095 #endif /* !RPL_CONF_MAX_INSTANCES */
00096 
00097 /*
00098  * Maximum of concurent dodag inside an instance
00099  */
00100 #ifndef RPL_CONF_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE
00101 #define RPL_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE     2
00102 #else
00103 #define RPL_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE     RPL_CONF_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE
00104 #endif /* !RPL_CONF_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE */
00105 
00106 /*
00107  * 
00108  */
00109 #ifndef RPL_CONF_DAO_SPECIFY_DAG
00110 #if RPL_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE > 1
00111 #define RPL_DAO_SPECIFY_DAG 1
00112 #else /* RPL_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE > 1*/
00113 #define RPL_DAO_SPECIFY_DAG 0
00114 #endif /* RPL_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE > 1 */
00115 #else /* RPL_CONF_DAO_SPECIFY_DAG */
00116 #define RPL_DAO_SPECIFY_DAG RPL_CONF_DAO_SPECIFY_DAG
00117 #endif /* RPL_CONF_DAO_SPECIFY_DAG */

00120 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00121 /* The amount of parents that this node has in a particular DAG. */
00122 #define RPL_PARENT_COUNT(dag)   list_length((dag)->parents)
00123 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00124 typedef uint16_t rpl_rank_t;
00125 typedef uint16_t rpl_ocp_t;
00126 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00127 /* DAG Metric Container Object Types, to be confirmed by IANA. */
00128 #define RPL_DAG_MC_NONE                 0 /* Local identifier for empty MC */
00129 #define RPL_DAG_MC_NSA                  1 /* Node State and Attributes */
00130 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY               2 /* Node Energy */
00131 #define RPL_DAG_MC_HOPCOUNT             3 /* Hop Count */
00132 #define RPL_DAG_MC_THROUGHPUT           4 /* Throughput */
00133 #define RPL_DAG_MC_LATENCY              5 /* Latency */
00134 #define RPL_DAG_MC_LQL                  6 /* Link Quality Level */
00135 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ETX                  7 /* Expected Transmission Count */
00136 #define RPL_DAG_MC_LC                   8 /* Link Color */
00137 
00138 /* DAG Metric Container flags. */
00139 #define RPL_DAG_MC_FLAG_P               0x8
00140 #define RPL_DAG_MC_FLAG_C               0x4
00141 #define RPL_DAG_MC_FLAG_O               0x2
00142 #define RPL_DAG_MC_FLAG_R               0x1
00143 
00144 /* DAG Metric Container aggregation mode. */
00145 #define RPL_DAG_MC_AGGR_ADDITIVE        0
00146 #define RPL_DAG_MC_AGGR_MAXIMUM         1
00147 #define RPL_DAG_MC_AGGR_MINIMUM         2
00148 #define RPL_DAG_MC_AGGR_MULTIPLICATIVE  3
00149 
00150 /* The bit index within the flags field of
00151    the rpl_metric_object_energy structure. */
00152 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY_INCLUDED      3
00153 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY_TYPE          1
00154 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY_ESTIMATION    0
00155 
00156 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY_TYPE_MAINS            0
00157 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY_TYPE_BATTERY          1
00158 #define RPL_DAG_MC_ENERGY_TYPE_SCAVENGING       2
00159 
00160 struct rpl_metric_object_energy {
00161   uint8_t flags;
00162   uint8_t energy_est;
00163 };
00164 
00165 /* Logical representation of a DAG Metric Container. */
00166 struct rpl_metric_container {
00167   uint8_t type;
00168   uint8_t flags;
00169   uint8_t aggr;
00170   uint8_t prec;
00171   uint8_t length;
00172   union metric_object {
00173     struct rpl_metric_object_energy energy;
00174     uint16_t etx;
00175   } obj;
00176 };
00177 typedef struct rpl_metric_container rpl_metric_container_t;
00178 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00179 struct rpl_instance;
00180 struct rpl_dag;
00181 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00182 struct rpl_parent {
00183   struct rpl_parent *next;
00184   struct rpl_dag *dag;
00185   rpl_metric_container_t mc;
00186   uip_ipaddr_t addr;
00187   rpl_rank_t rank;
00188   uint8_t link_metric;
00189   uint8_t dtsn;
00190   uint8_t updated;
00191 };
00192 typedef struct rpl_parent rpl_parent_t;
00193 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00194 /* RPL DIO prefix suboption */
00195 struct rpl_prefix {
00196   uip_ipaddr_t prefix;
00197   uint32_t lifetime;
00198   uint8_t length;
00199   uint8_t flags;
00200 };
00201 typedef struct rpl_prefix rpl_prefix_t;
00202 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00203 /* Directed Acyclic Graph */
00204 struct rpl_dag {
00205   uip_ipaddr_t dag_id;
00206   rpl_rank_t min_rank; /* should be reset per DAG iteration! */
00207   uint8_t version;
00208   uint8_t grounded;
00209   uint8_t preference;
00210   uint8_t used;
00211   /* live data for the DAG */
00212   uint8_t joined;
00213   rpl_parent_t *preferred_parent;
00214   rpl_rank_t rank;
00215   struct rpl_instance *instance;
00216   void *parent_list;
00217   list_t parents;
00218   rpl_prefix_t prefix_info;
00219 };
00220 typedef struct rpl_dag rpl_dag_t;
00221 typedef struct rpl_instance rpl_instance_t;
00222 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00223 /*
00224  * API for RPL objective functions (OF)
00225  *
00226  * reset(dag)
00227  *
00228  *  Resets the objective function state for a specific DAG. This function is
00229  *  called when doing a global repair on the DAG.
00230  *
00231  * parent_state_callback(parent, known, etx)
00232  *
00233  *  Receives link-layer neighbor information. The parameter "known" is set
00234  *  either to 0 or 1. The "etx" parameter specifies the current
00235  *  ETX(estimated transmissions) for the neighbor.
00236  *
00237  * best_parent(parent1, parent2)
00238  *
00239  *  Compares two parents and returns the best one, according to the OF.
00240  *
00241  * best_dag(dodag1, dodag2)
00242  *
00243  *  Compares two dodags and returns the best one, according to the OF.
00244  *
00245  * calculate_rank(parent, base_rank)
00246  *
00247  *  Calculates a rank value using the parent rank and a base rank.
00248  *  If "parent" is NULL, the objective function selects a default increment
00249  *  that is adds to the "base_rank". Otherwise, the OF uses information known
00250  *  about "parent" to select an increment to the "base_rank".
00251  *
00252  * update_metric_container(dag)
00253  *
00254  *  Updates the metric container for outgoing DIOs in a certain DAG.
00255  *  If the objective function of the DAG does not use metric containers, 
00256  *  the function should set the object type to RPL_DAG_MC_NONE.
00257  */
00258 struct rpl_of {
00259   void (*reset)(struct rpl_dag *);
00260   void (*parent_state_callback)(rpl_parent_t *, int, int);
00261   rpl_parent_t *(*best_parent)(rpl_parent_t *, rpl_parent_t *);
00262   rpl_dag_t *(*best_dag)(rpl_dag_t *, rpl_dag_t *);
00263   rpl_rank_t (*calculate_rank)(rpl_parent_t *, rpl_rank_t);
00264   void (*update_metric_container)( rpl_instance_t *);
00265   rpl_ocp_t ocp;
00266 };
00267 typedef struct rpl_of rpl_of_t;
00268 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00269 /* Instance */
00270 struct rpl_instance {
00271   /* DAG configuration */
00272   rpl_metric_container_t mc;
00273   rpl_of_t *of;
00274   rpl_dag_t *current_dag;
00275   rpl_dag_t dag_table[RPL_MAX_DAG_PER_INSTANCE];
00276   /* The current default router - used for routing "upwards" */
00277   uip_ds6_defrt_t *def_route;
00278   uint8_t instance_id;
00279   uint8_t used;
00280   uint8_t dtsn_out;
00281   uint8_t mop;
00282   uint8_t dio_intdoubl;
00283   uint8_t dio_intmin;
00284   uint8_t dio_redundancy;
00285   uint8_t default_lifetime;
00286   uint8_t dio_intcurrent;
00287   uint8_t dio_send; /* for keeping track of which mode the timer is in */
00288   uint8_t dio_counter;
00289   rpl_rank_t max_rankinc;
00290   rpl_rank_t min_hoprankinc;
00291   uint16_t lifetime_unit; /* lifetime in seconds = l_u * d_l */
00292 #if RPL_CONF_STATS
00293   uint16_t dio_totint;
00294   uint16_t dio_totsend;
00295   uint16_t dio_totrecv;
00296 #endif /* RPL_CONF_STATS */
00297   uint32_t dio_next_delay; /* delay for completion of dio interval */
00298   struct ctimer dio_timer;
00299   struct ctimer dao_timer;
00300 };
00301 
00302 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00303 /* Public RPL functions. */
00304 void rpl_init(void);
00305 void uip_rpl_input(void);
00306 rpl_dag_t *rpl_set_root(uint8_t instance_id, uip_ipaddr_t * dag_id);
00307 int rpl_set_prefix(rpl_dag_t *dag, uip_ipaddr_t *prefix, unsigned len);
00308 int rpl_repair_root(uint8_t instance_id);
00309 int rpl_set_default_route(rpl_instance_t *instance, uip_ipaddr_t *from);
00310 rpl_dag_t *rpl_get_any_dag(void);
00311 rpl_dag_t *rpl_get_dodag(uint8_t instance_id, uip_ipaddr_t *dag_id);
00312 rpl_instance_t *rpl_get_instance(uint8_t instance_id);
00313 void rpl_update_header_empty(void);
00314 int rpl_update_header_final(uip_ipaddr_t *addr);
00315 int rpl_verify_header(int);
00316 void rpl_remove_header(void);
00317 uint8_t rpl_invert_header(void);
00318 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00319 #endif /* RPL_H */
